486854.content:
Hello kagglers,

I have recently uploaded a dataset Vehicle Attributes and Emissions which consist of Year, Vehicle Class, Transmission and following columns,

Year: Indicates the year of manufacture for the vehicles in the dataset.

Make: Represents the brand or manufacturer of the vehicle, such as Acura, Audi, BMW, etc.

Model: Specifies the specific model of the vehicle produced by the manufacturer, for example, A4, 323Ci, NSX, etc.

Vehicle Class: Categorizes the vehicles into different classes based on their size and intended use, such as compact, mid-size, subcompact, etc.

Engine Size: Denotes the volume of the engine in liters, providing information about the capacity of the vehicle's powerplant.

Cylinders: Indicates the number of cylinders present in the vehicle's engine, providing insights into its design and performance characteristics.

Transmission: Specifies the type of transmission system used in the vehicle, such as automatic (A4, AS5) or manual (M5, M6).

Fuel: Identifies the type of fuel used by the vehicle, which could be represented by codes such as "X" or "Z", or unspecified "Other" categories.

Fuel Consumption: Presents ranges indicating the amount of fuel consumed by the vehicle over a given distance, providing insights into its efficiency.

CO2 Emissions: Provides ranges representing the quantity of carbon dioxide emitted by the vehicle, helping to evaluate its environmental impact.

Dataset link - <https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/krupadharamshi/fuelconsumption>\

Thank you.
486854.title: Vehicle Attributes and Emissions Dataset (Usability score : 10)

486704.content:
Just completed the "Intro to Machine Learning" course on Kaggle Learn, and I'm thrilled to share my journey with you all!

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F18205787%2F98a239eb80b8204c2cd6b0c51be3880d%2FAdham%20Allam%20-%20Intro%20to%20Machine%20Learning.png?generation=1711426888508774&alt=media)

Throughout this incredible learning adventure, I delved deep into the foundations of machine learning, mastering essential concepts and techniques. From grasping how models work to the intricacies of model validation, underfitting, and overfitting, every module was a step forward in my understanding.

Here's a snapshot of what I've learned:

1. Understanding the fundamentals of how models work.
2. Mastering basic data exploration techniques.
3. Building my first machine learning model from scratch.
4. Validating models effectively to ensure robust performance.
5. Tackling the challenges of underfitting and overfitting.
6. Harnessing the power of Random Forests for predictive modeling.
7. Exploring the thrilling realm of machine learning competitions.

This journey wouldn't have been as enriching without the well-crafted articles and engaging exercises provided by Kaggle Learn. A heartfelt thank you to the instructors and the entire Kaggle community for the support and encouragement along the way!

Excited to put my newfound knowledge into practice and embark on more machine learning adventures. Let's keep learning, exploring, and growing together!

# MachineLearning #KaggleLearn #DataScience #NeverStopLearning 🌟🤖📊

Hi dear friends!

Today, I am here to share one of my latest achievements - completing the 14th course on Kaggle, focusing on **data cleaning**. This is an essential and critical skill for any data science enthusiast, and I am very excited to take this step in my data science journey. 🚀\

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F17651006%2Fb2c4fa631a8fb2aa168a6665f3b8eb10%2Fhsling%20-%20Data%20Cleaning.png?generation=1711422343643851&alt=media)\

After completing this course, I have an in-depth understanding and practical experience in data cleaning. I realized that data cleaning was not just a necessity as a pre-processing step, but a cornerstone of ensuring success in data analysis and machine learning projects. Clean, uncluttered data can significantly improve model accuracy and reliability

I'm ready to apply what I've learned to more data science projects and continue to explore the other courses and competitions Kaggle has to offer. Data cleansing was just one step in the data science journey, but it opened up endless possibilities for me.

486527.content:
Hello kagglers,

I have recently uploaded a dataset Baseball Player Metrics which consist of detail about Years of Play, Games, At-Bats, Runs, Hits, and following columns,

1. Player: The name of the baseball player.
2. YRS: The number of years the player has been active in professional baseball.
3. G: The total number of games played by the player.
4. AB: The total number of at-bats (plate appearances) by the player.
5. R: The total number of runs scored by the player.
6. H: The total number of hits recorded by the player.
7. 2B: The total number of doubles hit by the player.
8. 3B: The total number of triples hit by the player.
9. HR: The total number of home runs hit by the player.
10. RBI: The total number of runs batted in (RBIs) by the player.

Dataset Link - <https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/krupadharamshi/500hits>

Thankyou

486508.content:
Hello Kagglers! \

Are you new to Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and looking for a beginner-friendly guide to get started? Look no further! In this notebook, I've put together a comprehensive introduction to CNNs, explaining the key concepts and providing hands-on examples using popular frameworks like TensorFlow and Sk Learn. Whether you're a student, an enthusiast, or a professional looking to expand your skillset, this notebook is designed to help you grasp the fundamentals of CNNs and kickstart your journey into the exciting world of deep learning.

**Topics Covered:**

1. Introduction to CNNs
2. Convolutional Layers
3. Pooling Layers
4. Fully Connected Layers
5. Building a Simple CNN Model
6. Fine-Tuning Pretrained Models
7. Common Challenges and Best Practices

**Notebook Link:** <https://www.kaggle.com/code/jaidalmotra/convolutional-neural-networks-a-beginner-s-guide>

**Feedback**: I welcome any feedback, questions, or suggestions you may have! Feel free to leave comments directly on the notebook, and I'll do my best to address them promptly.

**Next Steps**: If the response to this CNN notebook is positive, I'm excited to continue covering other topics in deep learning and machine learning. Let me know what you'd like to learn next!

Happy Learning!
486508.title: Beginner-Friendly Notebook: Introduction to Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)

486421.content:
Hi all, I had a thought. Most of us are here on Kaggle to try to improve our skill sets and become better Data Scientists. I personally have held mostly the same strategy since I started on Kaggle. I compete in competitions and then I look at the gold medal finishers' solutions with a fine tooth comb. My goal is to understand what led them to make the decisions nobody else saw. What did they do that I didn't think to try. For example, in this notebook, I get my first competition Gold medal. 

<https://www.kaggle.com/code/cody11null/14th-place-gold-cat-lgb-refit>

The core trick in this competition was refitting the model after some time had passed rather than only fitting the model at the time of submission. Check this notebook out and let me know what you think? What do you believe is the key to growth on Kaggle? 

I will also note, I put this post in the accomplishments category because I have heard that is where notebooks go now? If I am wrong about this let me know! Happy Kaggling!
486421.title: Best way to grow on Kaggle?

2717232.content:
From my 6 months of competing in featured competitions, 

It is extremely unlikely to get anywhere close to a gold medal just by using/slightly modifying public work, that is what most competitors are at least able to achieve. When I just started off, being new I was also doing this for the first 2 competitions which I participated.

As I acquire more knowledge, I realised this is **not** the optimal strategy to get a good result in competitions. Public work is there for one to study and incorporate some ideas if one think they are beneficial, not blindly forking and changing stuff like ensemble weights/hyperparameters to improve the score.

Thinking out of the box, to have an edge over other competitors is a must to differentiate amongst the crowd of close scores in a Kaggle competition.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F3102002%2Fb6f531db9b8431987bca5641c0d8d193%2FRag%20with%20Gemma.png?generation=1711292766805559&alt=media)

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is the concept of providing large language models (LLMs) with additional information from an external knowledge source. This allows them to generate more accurate and contextual answers while reducing hallucinations.

In this kaggle notebook, I provided a step-by-step guide to building a complete RAG application using the latest open-source LLM by Google Gemma 7B and open-source vector database by Faiss.

### You can try it from [here](https://www.kaggle.com/code/youssef19/building-rag-using-gemma-faiss-vector-db)
486360.title: New Kaggle Notebook: Building RAG Application using Gemma 7B LLM & Faiss Vector Database

486528.content:
Hello kagglers;

I am delighted and way too excited to share my latest work or my latest dataset on Amazon stocks between 1997-2011. I also made a LSTM model on the same. It contains of the following : 

Date: The date of the trading session.

Open: The opening price of the asset at the beginning of the trading session.

High: The highest price reached by the asset during the trading session.

Low: The lowest price reached by the asset during the trading session.

Close: The closing price of the asset at the end of the trading session.

Adj Close: The adjusted closing price, possibly accounting for factors such as dividends and stock splits.

Volume: The trading volume, indicating the total number of shares or contracts traded during the session.

Dataset Link : <https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/deeplearner09/amazon-stock-dataset-1997-2021>

Thank you and Have a great day !!!
486528.title: Amazon stocks dataset between 1997-2011. (Usability score : 10).

2714761.content:
First of all, congratulations

You replied to one of my notebooks . Your comment caught my attention and I also saw this announcement, so I looked into your medals.


> 
> Your visualisations are excellent. They make the data much easier to understand. I voted up all of your work.
> 
> 
> 

<https://www.kaggle.com/code/bwandowando/summarize-a-member-s-posts-in-the-forums/comments#2713225>

## Analysis

So apparently, 216 of your medals have come from notebooks posts

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F1842206%2F1f85641bb9e75271e4a530934f2efb57%2FScreenshot%20from%202024-03-25%2012-15-47.png?generation=1711340167621144&alt=media)

And i Looked into your notebook posts, most, if not all, of your notebook Bronze medals came from such comments. 

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F1842206%2Ff18a0be75f4eb9db2acabe3d42a5b2f0%2FScreenshot%20from%202024-03-25%2012-15-16.png?generation=1711340253827444&alt=media)

using wordcloud

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F1842206%2F40cb6a6d1792a7641456e88afb0a0173%2FScreenshot%20from%202024-03-25%2012-20-37.png?generation=1711340456560678&alt=media)

IMHO, and correct me if im wrong, but getting 200 Bronze medals from saying "**Great work!**" and "**ive upvoted all your work!**" doesnt really hold much value.

## Summary

Like I said, congratulations, but I believe it would be more rewarding if our medals and commendations came from forum posts that give back to the community or teaching others and imparting them with knowledge, like an article that you've researched, or a piece of code that was complex and you'd like to teach others with. 

Looking forward to more content from you that is more of teaching and imparting our fellow members with knowledge and skills .

486287.content:
## Celebrating the achievement of the first image series notebook 🎉🚀

Today, I'm excited to announce that I've successfully launched my first image series notebook! 🥳 This is an exciting moment and marks the culmination of my tireless efforts. 💪

Friends can find a wealth of content and examples in my first image series notebook. [Click here to view our notebook!](https://www.kaggle.com/code/wolfmedal/1-02-image-basic-access) \

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F17651006%2Fc375d21dd635a96566b9f9305a3248f9%2F_20240324180405.png?generation=1711274665492099&alt=media)

Hey Kagglers; 

I am excited to share this huge dataset that i recently found it contains the stock dataset of Amazon between 1997-2021 and the following : 

Date: The date of the trading session.

Open: The opening price of the asset at the beginning of the trading session.

High: The highest price reached by the asset during the trading session.

Low: The lowest price reached by the asset during the trading session.

Close: The closing price of the asset at the end of the trading session.

Adj Close: The adjusted closing price, possibly accounting for factors such as dividends and stock splits.

Volume: The trading volume, indicating the total number of shares or contracts traded during the session.

486284.content:
Hello, Kaggle Community!

I'm happy to share a personal milestone. As 2024 started I vowed to help improve ML on tabular data (instead of getting lost in that LLM space). 

One of the way to do so was to build my own competition. The competition is available here: <https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/bench-tab-v1/discussion/467768> The goal is to provide a good benchmark for tabular models, replicating the paper <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2207.08815.pdf> from [@leogri](https://www.kaggle.com/leogri) . I hope it will help improve models but also our understanding of those 'black box' and what is driving their performance. Such a competition, accessible to the community helps fostering a spirit of collaboration and mutual growth.

Key Highlights (so far):

* **Competitions provides around 60 datasets**, partitioned in 4 categories (whether data and/or targets includes categoricals). I personally hope to see if we can get from data what is driving final performance.
* **Metric** is improvement over a baseline, an ensemble of catboost.
* It has been on-ongoing for 2 months and **there is still more than one month to run**.
* Discussion: some interesting discussion about also on tabular data. Gbdts are by far the most used (because easier to use?).
* **Baseline:** this discussion <https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/bench-tab-v1/discussion/467768> from [@carlmcbrideellis](https://www.kaggle.com/carlmcbrideellis) confirms initial findings. On untuned models:

x **Catboost** is best out of the box. \

x Out of the box, **Lgbm** is 20x faster while retaining most of the performance. (or conversely catboost is 20x times slower for slightly better performance - not sure that comparison is entirely fair to lgbm)\

x Out of the box, **Xgboost**, despite significant improvements in its 2.0 version is lagging behind both in terms of performance and training time.

* Current Top solution achieves a **10% overall improvement in loss reduction**. I wonder what is going on. (I suspect some feature engineering).
* Community also shared notebooks: <https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/bench-tab-v1> I personally would like to see more diverse baselines, notably on the NN side.

The journey is not finished:

* First, the competition is still on-going. There is still a month to explore cutting edge technologies and make progress on the use of ML on tabular data. Feel free to participate, discuss, share insights. For this there is no better approach than participating: <https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/bench-tab-v1>
* I also intend to update the competition with our main findings. Your feedback, questions, and insights will be taken into account.
* I am also considering getting co-hosts. Feel free to reach out to me if you want to help, more specifically if you are willing to help gather more datasets / help on communication to improve participation.

A huge thank you to everyone who has been a part of this project, directly or indirectly. Your support, encouragement, and constructive criticism have been the driving forces behind tabular ML progress. Let's continue to push the boundaries of what's possible together.

Best,\

Lucas
486284.title: Building my first serious competition: a tabular data benchmark

🌏 Our investigation takes a granular look at the evolution of geothermal energy capacity, dissecting the subtleties of Turkey's geothermal growth patterns in relation to global trends. Our quest was to decipher the technological and policy catalysts shaping the expansion of geothermal energy and to place Turkey's progress within the broader geothermal energy vista.

This study not only reflects upon the current state but also strives to offer strategic insights that could influence policy-making, investment strategies, and infrastructural advancements in the geothermal sector.

2712298.content:
[@sandeepmistry2004](https://www.kaggle.com/sandeepmistry2004) some tips-

1. Choose assignments wisely but participate regularly as well
2. Team up well- this is a very good way to succeed
3. Try and be active through the 3-months of the assignment and start early
4. Peruse public materials well and to your advantage, but design your own work
5. Try and implement a good CV scheme locally. This will help you a lot through the challenge
6. EDA and feature engineering are most important for all challenges
7. Don't engage in questionable post-processing that suit the public LB, find a balance between CV and LB

Be patient and stay active, learning is fun!

486102.content:
# SUP Guys & Girls,

I have lost in my solitary for many days now , thanks to school exams , exams are finally over and it's for some party…

Just kidding some projects…

I have done many competition on this great platform , but I think Kaggle lacks the most important part of machine learning which is surely **deployment** , so I decided to deployment one of models from competition to IRL( IN Real life) , it's most important bcoz ,No Non-technical person generally wants look in your Jupyter notebook , They want final output, So here is the project..

I have the project done and now I had deployed it on streamlit instead here it the link churn bank [project](https://churn-ai-app.streamlit.app/)\

Actually I also really excited to show see my project which based on this [Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/playground-series-s4e1) Competition .. , it is deployed using Streamlit, 

Tech Used:-\

Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Frontend (React Js , HTML , CSS, JSX[I had deleted them all current version bcoz Streamlit does the job , you can see them in commits if you want to ]) , Docker(Also deleted current, tried to deploy on AWS EC2 Machine ), And a lot of hard work and fun …

And special thanks for Streamlit to provide such deployment facility for free and I had tried to deploy it on the Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Google Cloud or Microsoft Azure, but all them don't have empathy for a 16 year old student. from his home..( I mean they all ask for credit card information , I don't have it, [forget it legally can't have my hands on Credit Card])

Here is source code for nerd developers 😊😉\

<https://github.com/luficerg/churn.ai>

Try give feedback if possible ???

I am really really happy as it's first project bcoz *first time is always the hardest time*

Currently working on second one… if possible I will share that achievement also..

Thank you for reading …

In the recently ended **Optiver - Trading at the Close** competition, my team received a gold medal from placing 14/4436 (top 0.3%)

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F5256933%2Fbe27296f1dc78637be4cc76593b1643e%2FIMG_7231.jpeg?generation=1711187694496266&alt=media)

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F5256933%2Fa4d67e2fdb2187fca9b1d8ae6e794a2f%2FIMG_7232.jpeg?generation=1711188363734195&alt=media)

With that, 10 months post-Bachelor, without any advanced degree, and juggling a full time job, I have earned the Competitions Master title! 

I started being active on Kaggle during the last semester of my Bachelor’s degree as part of my Machine Learning course and have been hooked on it since. I found it is really effective as a platform to learn from the best of the best and implement my ML ideas/ research paper ideas into code. It was SO useful to do this as a favourite pastime and grow my career and data science knowledge! I would say I spent more than 75% of my spare time on Kaggle Competitions and learning more ML skills for the past 9 months.

Looking forward for more! The need for skillsets involving LLMs is on the rise these days 😀. Aiming for the Competitions Grandmaster title next, will be tough but am absolutely up for the challenge!

Hello everyone!

2713675.content:
Congratulations on your success on the two fronts, especially on the later, won't happen overnight. \

I wanna ask about marathon race. Never done the full as of yet. How does it compare with the half in terms of race day exertion and time needed for training? How does the finish time compare with the VO2\_max projection time from the half-marathon training? I always felt that the projection time is a little optimistic. Would love to hear back. And thanks in advance

2715214.content:
Hey [@desalegngeb](https://www.kaggle.com/desalegngeb) ! First of all, thank you for your love and support. Those things are driving me through my DS journey. The Kaggle community is something, for sure! ❤️

About the Marathon. I've never ran 42 km before the race, so I was a bit cautious and didn't run full speed - and that was a good decision. I find the full M is much more challenging than HM in terms of endurance. It is a long race, so fatigue is real. I've running for 3 years and I had only 1 month of slight training before the race. That was enough for me to run the race but was not enough to show the best results.

I also found the VO2Max projection to be optimistic. My projection for the M was 3h 50m. I did it in 4h 27m. Maybe, because VO2Max takes in regards only the oxygen metabolism. And in my case, the biggest challenges were the knees and the legs. They weren't prepared properly for such long-distance races and started to hurt after the 15th km. 

I also didn't know what to expect and tried to save energy for the last. Maybe, with the proper training and knowing the pace for M, I would make under 4h, but 3:50 - is way too optimistic. 

For the next M, I would give myself 3-6 months of special training. And I also would include 1-2 long-distance runs in my weekly routine.

Hello Kaggle Community 👋,

Today, I'm thrilled to share with you a data-centric analysis focusing on 'Biofuel's Role in Sustainable Energy: Business Challenges and Opportunities'. This investigation dives into the intricate world of biofuel, a key component of the sustainable energy matrix, and its impact on the business domain.

🔍 In our detailed study, we analyze the biofuel industry from multiple business perspectives:

**Production and Consumption Dynamics:** We examine global biofuel production and consumption trends to - understand regional dynamics.\

**Policy Impact Analysis:** The influence of governmental policies and incentives on biofuel industry growth is critically assessed.\

**Investment and Growth Opportunities:** We identify and explore potential investment opportunities by scrutinizing growth patterns within the biofuel sector.

🌱 The insights gathered from this dataset are intended to support strategic decision-making and spotlight investment prospects in the biofuel arena. This exploration is not just about numbers, but the stories they tell about efficiency, sustainability, and the future of energy consumption.

👉 Please visit my research notebook here for an in-depth look at the analysis and insights

**<https://www.kaggle.com/code/mehmetisik/16-biofuel-production-analysis>**

I welcome your thoughts, feedback, and discussions on this topic. Let's explore the potential of biofuel together!

For more insights and data-driven analyses, check out my Kaggle profile

**<https://www.kaggle.com/mehmetisik/code>**

of course:)\

it is important to keep the notebook quality high, however that by itself is not enough. you might write the best notebook in the world, but if noone sees it, you wont get a medal. so, you should also aim for high number of views. to do that, there are multiple ways, just use the best that fits you:

* competition notebooks: competitions are hot topic. if you score highest or contribute significantly, votes will come.
* combine with datasets: you can publish on hot datasets or even create a hot dataset of your own.
* combine with discussions: being active in kaggle will improve your visibility.

this all depends on your personal goals as well. hope this helps.

# Celebrating my completion of the computer vision course at Kaggle📚

I already had some knowledge of machine learning before I decided to delve into computer vision. However, computer vision, as a branch of machine learning, has always been full of mystery to me. "How can pictures and videos be converted into data that machines can understand?" This question has always troubled me. Fortunately, I found a computer vision course on Kaggle, which not only started my learning journey, but also completely changed my view on this field.\

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-forum-message-attachments/o/inbox%2F17651006%2F17d1533e86e29b9134ab3ea5e5b828e1%2Fhslingkrs%20-%20Computer%20Vision.png?generation=1710983401365956&alt=media)\

485433.content:
Hello Kaggle Community,\

I'm thrilled to share that we've hit a phenomenal milestone together - 3,000 upvotes! This couldn't have been possible without your brilliant minds and spirited engagement. Let's take a moment to highlight our collective wins with a dash of fun:

1. 🍳 **[Egg-cellent Sales Analysis](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kanchana1990/egg-sales-of-a-local-shop-for-30-years):** This dataset wasn't just about counting eggs; it was about uncovering the stories behind the numbers. Your insights were nothing short of brilliant!
2. **[Melody Metrics](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kanchana1990/melody-metrics-decoding-song-popularity):** Together, we hit the high notes in analyzing what makes a song stick. Your analyses were music to my data-loving ears!
3. **[Spotify's Decade of Hits](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kanchana1990/spotifys-long-hits-2014-2024):** We charted the course of a decade's worth of tunes and trends, thanks to your harmonious contributions.
4. **[iPhone Pricing Insights](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kanchana1990/ebay-iphone-pricing-trends-2023):** Navigating the ebbs and flows of iPhone prices, your analyses were as sleek and sharp as the gadgets themselves.\

This journey has been an incredible learning experience, made richer by your participation and insights. As we celebrate this milestone, I'm reminded that our community's strength lies in our diversity of thought, creativity, and collaboration.\

Here's to continuing our adventure in data discovery, with more datasets, more insights, and more milestones to celebrate!\

Warm regards,\

Kanchana1990\

> 
> I'm really excited to share My First Multi-Page Streamlit Web Application, which is based on My Classification Project : 𝗦𝗽𝗮𝗰𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗧𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗰 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. \
> 
>  Its My First 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗣𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗪𝗲𝗯 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, which I used to create 2 Pages to demonstrate two different aspects of My Project. It contains a 𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗯𝗮𝗿 which let's you choose different pages seamlessly by using a 𝗗𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗱𝗼𝘄𝗻 𝗠𝗲𝗻𝘂.\
> 
>  It also contains a 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗯𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 in the Sidebar, which lets you contribute to the project by 𝗚𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀, 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗥𝗲𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 and 𝗗𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗭𝗜𝗣 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗿𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁.\
> 
>  𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲'𝘀 𝗮 𝗤𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝗥𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗼𝘄𝗻 𝗼𝗳 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗔𝗽𝗽 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀 :\
> 
>  1️⃣ 𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗣𝗮𝗴𝗲 \
> 
>  • The first page of the app dive deep into the 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗺 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 of the Project, It lets you get a proper understanding of what the problem is and what we are trying to predict. \
> 
>  • It also provides an 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮 being used, including its features and variables. It also lets you view the Data by using a 𝗧𝗼𝗴𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗪𝗶𝗱𝗴𝗲𝘁 and 𝗗𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮 𝗮𝘀 𝗖𝗦𝗩 using a 𝗗𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱 𝗕𝘂𝘁𝘁𝗼𝗻.\
> 
>  2️⃣ 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗱 𝗣𝗮𝗴𝗲\
> 
>  • The second page contains the 𝗪𝗲𝗯 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 itself which lets you choose different features and enter different variables related to the Project and Predict whether the Passenger was transported to an Alternate Dimension or not.\
> 
>  👉 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗔𝗽𝗽 𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲 : [Spaceship Titanic App](https://spaceship-titanic-classification.streamlit.app/)\

485295.content:
In this comprehensive exploration, I dive deep into the Diabetes dataset, employing various data analysis techniques and feature engineering strategies to uncover insights and prepare the data for predictive modeling. Whether you're a data science enthusiast, a professional looking to refine your skills, or simply curious about the power of data in healthcare, this notebook has something for you.

Key Highlights:

Detailed data cleaning and preprocessing steps to tackle missing values and outliers.\

Exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the distribution and relationship between variables.\

Innovative feature engineering techniques to enhance model performance.\

Correlation analysis to identify key factors associated with diabetes.\

Practical tips and best practices for data analysis and feature engineering.\

This notebook aims to not only provide a thorough analysis of the diabetes dataset but also to illustrate the importance of proper data preparation in the journey from data to insights. I've shared my thought process, code snippets, and visualizations to make it as informative and user-friendly as possible.

I'd love your feedback, questions, or insights! Let's learn from each other and make data science an even more collaborative and enlightening field. Check out the notebook, leave your comments, and feel free to share it with your network.

🔗 <https://www.kaggle.com/code/damlapeker/diabetes-data-analysis-feature-engineering/settings> 

Happy analyzing! 📊💡

# DataScience #Kaggle #FeatureEngineering #DataAnalysis #MachineLearning #DiabetesAwareness
